Title:
Two new species of Russula subsect. Xerampelinae from
China.
Keywords:
Agaricomycetes, Basidiomycota, morphology, phylogeny,
Russulaceae, Russulales
Abstract:
Two closely related new species of Russula subsect.
Xerampelinae, R. paragraveolens and R. pseudograveolens were described
base on morphology and ITS phylogeny from China. These two species are
close to R. graveolens in phylogeny. They can be distinguished from R.
graveolens for their smaller dimensions of basidia and pleurocystidia.
Russula pseudograveolens is different from R. paragraveolens because it
has shorter basidia, wider pileipellis hyphae, and a subtropical
habitat. Morphological discriminations between the two new species and
the other common taxa of R. subsect. Xerampelinae were also
provided.
